contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox file format | name = XCOFF | extension = none, <tt>.o</tt> | mime = | owner = [[IBM]] | creatorcode = | genre = [[Binary file|Binary]], [[executable]], [[object code|object]], [[shared libraries]] | containerfor = | containedby = | extendedfrom = [[COFF]] | extendedto = }} '''XCOFF''', for "eXtended COFF", is an improved and expanded version of the [[COFF]] [[object file format]] defined by [[IBM]] and used in [[AIX operating system|AIX]]. Early versions of the [[PowerPC]] [[Apple Macintosh|Macintosh]] also supported XCOFF, as did [[BeOS]]. XCOFF additions include the use of '''[[IBM Basic assembly language#Machine instructions (mnemonic)|csects]]''' to provide subsection granularity of cross-references, and the use of [[stabs]] for [[debugging]]. Information for the handling of [[shared library|shared libraries]] is also more elaborate than for plain COFF. More recently, IBM defined an '''XCOFF64''' version supporting [[64-bit]] [[IBM AIX|AIX]], and used '''XCOFF32''' to mean the original file format. ==See also== * [[Comparison of executable file formats]] ==External links== * [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/pseries/v5r3/topic/com.ibm.aix.files/doc/aixfiles/XCOFF.htm IBM's description of XCOFF] {{Executables}} {{Unix-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xcoff}} [[Category:Executable file formats]] [[Category:IBM operating systems]]
